encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

And may the magistrate who acts in his capacity as the] magistrate of May- 4.faʿat be aided by Siyān and Ḥaw[l and Ḥalayʾīl and the king of Ḥaḍramōt against that of which he is negligent and] 5.repair the walls of Ma[yfaʿat and their towers. And may he repair the damage of that which has been strengthened] 6.and that which has not been [strengthened. And may he continue to serve the king of Ḥaḍramōt. And may he] 7.repair that portion of the [walls and the towers which has] suffered damage.

Restored full text of the inscription:
Wahabum bin Ḍaʾisum, the minister of Yadaʿʾīl Bayyin bin Sumhūyafaʿ and ʾĪlī-
samaʿ Dhubyān bin Malkīkarib, the two kings of Ḥaḍramōt, has directed and constructed the wall
of Mayfaʿat out of stone and wood and brick. And may the magistrate who acts in his capacity as the magistrate of May-
faʿat be aided by Siyān and Ḥawl and Ḥalayʾīl and the king of Ḥaḍramōt against that of which he is negligent and
repair the walls of Mayfaʿat and their towers. And may he repair the damage of that which has been strengthened
and that which has not been strengthened. And may he continue to serve the king of Ḥaḍramōt. And may he
repair that portion of the walls and the towers which has suffered damage.
